subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Usage limits apply, with higher limits for GPT-4o compared to GPT-4. Not a hard token cap.
5x more usage than the free tier, with access to higher-tier models like Claude 3.5 Sonnet.

pricing_analysis.most_efficient: Claude 3 Haiku (for speed tasks), DeepSeek V2 & Qwen2 (for cost-to-performance ratio), GPT-4o (for flagship model efficiency). Self-hosted open-source models like Meta Llama 3 can be the most efficient if infrastructure costs are managed.
pricing_analysis.trend: The market is in a significant price war, drastically lowering token costs, especially for input tokens. Subscriptions for premium consumer access have largely standardized around $20/month. Output token costs remain higher than input costs. A new tier of highly efficient, lower-cost models (e.g., Claude Haiku, Gemini 1.5 Flash) is emerging, and open-source models hosted by providers like DeepSeek and Qwen are offering aggressive pricing, challenging established players. Enterprise pricing remains highly customized and volume-based.
